required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Burn Out and Quality of Life at French General Practioners
clinical_study.official_title: Burn Out and Quality of Life at French General Practioners: is There a Link

brief_summary.textblock: The suffering of caregivers is constantly increasing. General medicine, because of its primary role in primary care, is particularly exposed to the risk of burn-out and must protect itself. The aim of this study was to find an inverse relationship between health-related quality of life and being severely burned by French general practitioners.

primary_outcome.description: Maslach Burn-out Inventory scale, 22 Items sort to 0 (never) at 6 (every day) 3 class : An emotional exhaustion (EE), depersonalization (DP) and a reduction of personal accomplishment (AP) The emotional exhaustion (when emotional resources are exhausted, when the workers can no longer give their best, psychologically speaking.) The Depersonalization (reflects withdrawal, indifference to work) The lose of personal accomplishment (devaluation, negative self-evaluation at work) Our study focused on severe burn-out, defined by the combination of high EE and DP scores and low AP scores: A high EE is defined by a score > 30 A high PD is defined by a score > 12 A low PA is defined by a score < 33.

primary_outcome.measure: Assesment quality of life: Dukes Scale
primary_outcome.description: The Duke Health Profile 17 items questionnaire. It assesses health-related quality of life and has 10 dimensions. The score of each of the 10 dimensions matches with the sum of the item scores, standardized from 0 to 100: For the 6 health scores (general, physical, mental, social, perceived health and self-esteem) 100 specifies the best HRQoL, For the 4 scores of the dysfunction dimension (anxiety, depression, pain, disability), 100 specifies the most significant dysfunction

secondary_outcome.description: mode of practice (alone, group, liberal..), the number of hours worked, (hours) the number of monthly guards, (months) the number of daily acts, (acts number) the number of weeks of annual leave, (weeks)

he practice of a sports or leisure activity, (yes, not) he presence or absence of a work stoppage during the last twelve months (weeks) the duration, the need to have had to adjust his working time (yes, not)

study_pop.textblock: All french general practitioner in activity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- french general practitioner in liberal activity
Exclusion Criteria:
- retired doctor
- junior general practioner
